content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation with purposes that include upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States while respecting the sovereignty of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Nations. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to unite American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, advocate for their needs, promote social welfare, and support research related to their experiences. The organization also provides technical assistance to regional areas without veterans committees or organizations, offering outreach services and training Tribal Veterans Service Officers. Membership eligibility and rights are determined by the corporation's constitution and by-laws, while the board of directors' responsibilities are outlined in conformity with the laws under which the corporation is incorporated. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated ensures conformity with laws for officers, nondiscrimination in membership, limited powers, and exclusive rights to certain names and symbols. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated has exclusive rights to certain names and symbols, and restrictions include no stock issuance, dividends, income distribution to members, officers, or directors, and prohibition of loans to officials. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is prohibited from making loans to its officers, directors, members, or employees. It cannot claim congressional approval or Federal Government authority for its activities. The organization must maintain its tax-exempt status and keep accurate records that can be inspected by members for any proper purpose. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated must comply with laws regarding service of process and liability for acts of officers and agents. Failure to comply with the requirements of this chapter may result in consequences. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated must comply with laws, including reporting annually to Congress. Failure to comply may result in the expiration of the charter granted by this chapter.
